ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Stun/root
ygData.msgSnippet: Yea, I ve heard that, however until our bard gets chains, we are kind out of options.  We had a a Ranger AND a druid in our original group, but the Druid is 32
ygData.messageBody:
Yea, I've heard that, however until our bard gets chains, we are kind
out of options. We had a a Ranger AND a druid in our original group,
but the Druid is 32 (to our 18) now and the Ranger has not played in two
months... With the two potential people coming in, I told them to make
the character they want, not what we need. Given the choice, I think i
wanted a druid and another tank to fill out the group (still no
enchanter, but we can make do with the bard)
>
> In my experience, the darkness line is inferior to snare.
> Stuff with darkness on it will start to run *before* the
> darkness will halt their movement. So they'll still manage to
> flee a bit depending on how quickly you're damaging it.
> Early on Chain acts pretty much like snare. But later (level
> thirty-something?) it will stop runners when they're at half
> hp. That makes it superior to snare for stopping green
> runners, since greenies tend to run when they drop below half.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
